page.title: 11SPANIARD'S VIEW TRANSLATED
page.content:
{ TRANSLATION The New Bield in Lyveden is a ruin of a house built in 1594, protected by the National Trust.Lyveden is the same as other places in England (Trees and Fields etc.) A difference between the Spanish countryside and the English countryside is that the English countryside is more well kept than the Spanish countryside.The National Trust is responsible for the upkeep of certain historical features. They have not got one of those in Spain, but I think it would be a good idea to have one so that in the future we can study interesting aspects of our past.
{ EMILIO FERNANDEZ}from north-west Spain was staying with a student from Prince William School, Oundle at the time of the survey in July 1985.
